zero-sum game.translation[0].definitions: a situation in which you receive as much money or advantages as you give away
Diplomatic negotiations often aim at a zero-sum game.
zero-sum game.translation[1].definitions: a situation in which a balance is achieved between something such as money received and something given away
The utility business is a zero-sum game - if local governments chopped $ 8 million off their power bills, that fiscal load would just be dumped onto the backs of other ratepayers.
